intro: Plantago suffruticosa, commonly known as the shrubby plantain, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, woody stems covered in dense, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in racemes, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their soothing properties. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges.
